item.title: John add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: John add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "To love is to suffer and there can be no love otherwise." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: John add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Don’t let us forget that the causes of human actions are usually immeasurably more complex and varied than our subsequent explanations of them." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: John add a quote by Edward P. Jones
item.description: "Calvin had long been uneasy in his own person and so lived to put everyone else at ease." -- Edward P. Jones

item.title: John add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: John add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: John add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: John add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description:
"The Paradoxical Commandments
People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
If you do good, people will accuse you of selfish ulterior motives. Do good anyway.
If you are successful, you will win false friends and true enemies. Succeed anyway.
The good you do today will be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway.
Honesty and frankness make you vulnerable. Be honest and frank anyway.
The biggest men and women with the biggest ideas can be shot down by the smallest men and women with the smallest minds. Think big anyway.
People favor underdogs but follow only top dogs. Fight for a few underdogs anyway.
What you spend years building may be destroyed overnight. Build anyway.
People really need help but may attack you if you do help them. Help people anyway.
Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth. Give the world the best you have anyway." -- Kent M. Keith

item.title: John add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I can give you my loneliness, my darkness, the hunger of my heart, I am trying to bribe you with uncertainty, with danger, with defeat." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "The mind was dreaming. The world was its dream." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Whatever one man does, it is as if all men did it. For that reason, it is not unfair that one disobedience in a garden should contaminate all humanity; for that reason it is not unjust that the crucifixion of a single Jew should be sufficient to save it." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Writing is nothing more than a guided dream." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Time is the tiger that devours me, but I am that tiger." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "What man of us has never felt, walking through the twilight or writing down a date from his past, that he has lost something infinite?" -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Nothing is built on stone; All is built on sand, but we must build as if the sand were stone." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: John add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: John add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The Christian ideal has not been tried and found wanting. It has been found difficult; and left untried." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: John add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: John add a quote by Chesterton, G. K. (Gilbert Keith)
item.description: "There is the great lesson of 'Beauty and the Beast,' that a thing must be loved before it is lovable." -- Chesterton, G. K. (Gilbert Keith)

item.title: John add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Love means to love that which is unlovable; or it is no virtue at all." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: John add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "We fear men so much, because we fear God so little. One fear cures another. When man's terror scares you, turn your thoughts to the wrath of God." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: John add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: John add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: John add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: John add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To be a Christian means to forgive the inexcusable because God has forgiven the inexcusable in you." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: John add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "Experience is a brutal teacher, but you learn fast." -- William Nicholson

item.title: John add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Love is something more stern and splendid than mere kindness." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: John add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness." -- Joseph Conrad
